# privatekey

Points: 113, Solves: 420

Author: allu
## Problem Description
something's smaller
## Reading Material:
[Boneh-Durfee Attack](https://cryptohack.gitbook.io/cryptobook/untitled/low-private-component-attacks/boneh-durfee-attack)

[Wiener's Attack](https://cryptohack.gitbook.io/cryptobook/untitled/low-private-component-attacks/wieners-attack)
## Solution
Upon opening up the file chal.txt, we are met with "classic" RSA.
```
N = 
e = 
c = 
```

Because we are given N, e, and c values, we can deduce that this is an RSA challenge. At first, it's not exactly clear how to proceed. Noticing that the e value is extremely large, we can try Boneh-Durfee Attack. This attack is a special scenario in which the private key $d<N^{0.292}$. [dCode](https://www.dcode.fr/rsa-cipher) is a very good website that automatically applies Boneh-Durfee Attack (an extension of Wiener's Attack). If you prefer not to use the website, there is a good script implementation in the Reading Material. Regardless of which method we use, we end up at the flag.

Flag: `LITCTF{w13n3r_15_4n_unf0rtun4t3_n4m3}`
